reviews.review:
This movie is messy. It's like a video game where the characters have to do side quests, collecting an item and going from Point A to Point B. It didn't flow organically. 

The movie would've been more enjoyable for me if they focused on Rey and Kylo's relationship. The rest of the supporting characters were underutilize and underdeveloped. Daisy Ridley and Adam Driver's scenes together is one of the few things I liked about the movie.
Rest In PEACE Star Wars Lore. This movie manages to completely undo everything the original trilogy and prequels established. I didn't think it could get any worse than the Last Jedi.
Just got home from Skywalker. Honestly, I don't understand why all the nerds are so mad.  I thought this movie was the best one out of all 9 of them. Thoroughly enjoyed it!

Now that the dust has settled and I've processed much of what I saw upon viewing The Rise of Skywalker, I thought I'd offer my critique as one of the world's foremost movie critics.  First, my view hasn't changed.  I absolutely and thoroughly enjoyed the film.  

It is not a perfect film by any means.  There is a lot going on in the movie.  A lot.  It's constantly flowing from dire situation to dire situation without much reprieve in between.  There are a few plot holes but overall I found it to be a love letter to fans both new and old in that it does a good job of concluding the forty plus years of the Skywalker Saga.

The question regarding whether the Sequel Trilogy needed to be made at all will continue to be debated.  In a way, the Saga could have remained the original six movies and that would have been quite fine.  While it was great to see my childhood heroes again, seeing their demise as the movies went on was painful to see.  

What is clear is that, upon viewing this movie, is that there was so much wasted in The Last Jedi.  It seems so much time was spent on Ach-to, the space chase and Canto Bight that could've been better used advancing the overall narrative and arc.  It seems J.J. was forced to course correct far too much and, as a result, we are left with a very busy finale.

With all that, I loved the movie and will see it multiple times I'm sure.  There are many great moments in the film that will shock, surprise and tug at the heartstrings.  For this long time fan since the age of four, that's all I could ask for.
The action is okay but this is some of the worst storytelling in film history
Tied with ESB for best Star Wars film ever!!!!
Few plot holes but overall really enjoyable! Great Star Wars movie

Totally rushed. They pulled this lore out of nowhere. My expectations were low after the Last Jedi but still this movie was sad. Rey's character wasn't believable nor was the pay off with the original characters satisfying. Only bright spot for Star Wars is Mandalorian.
A thrilling conclusion to a beloved saga. I was grinning ear to ear throughout.  The movie is FUN, enjoy it.
Tied up loose ends, but it seemed pretty forced.
